intro: Ctenitis melanosticta, commonly known as the black-stained hawksbeard, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is native to parts of eastern North America, including the southeastern United States. Ctenitis melanosticta is often found in moist soil and is a hardy perennial that thrives in partial to full shade.
